channel.title: Norway on Logotyp.us
channel.description: Recent content in Norway on Logotyp.us

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Aker Solutions Logo
Aker Solutions ASA, an engineering company based in Oslo, provides the products, systems and services required to unlock energy from sources such as oil, gas and offshore wind. The company, founded in 1841, was known as Aker Kværner until 2008. Aker Kværner was founded in 2004 from the major restructuring of a complex “Aker Kværner” business unit, formed originally in 2002 by the merger of Aker Maritime and Kværner Oil & Gas.
You can download theAker Solutionslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Aker Solutions
item.description: Aker Solutions ASA, an engineering company based in Oslo, provides the products, systems and services required to unlock energy from sources such as oil, gas and offshore wind. The company, founded in 1841, was known as Aker Kværner until 2008. Aker Kværner was founded in 2004 from the major restructuring of a complex “Aker Kværner” business unit, formed originally in 2002 by the merger of Aker Maritime and Kværner Oil & Gas.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Sevan Marine Logo Sevan Marine ASA is specializing in design, engineering and project execution of floating units for offshore applications. The main product is cylinder platforms used for floating production and drilling. The company is based in Arendal but also has office in Oslo and Singapore. Sevan Marine ASA is listed on Oslo Børs with ticker SEVAN. Source
You can download theSevan Marinelogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Sevan Marine
item.description: Sevan Marine ASA is specializing in design, engineering and project execution of floating units for offshore applications. The main product is cylinder platforms used for floating production and drilling. The company is based in Arendal but also has office in Oslo and Singapore. Sevan Marine ASA is listed on Oslo Børs with ticker SEVAN. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 TGS-NOPEC Geophysical Company Logo
TGS-NOPEC Geophysical Company ASA, referred to as TGS and listed on the Oslo Stock Exchange, was founded by a 1998 merger of TGS, Calibre Geophysical Co. Inc, and NOPEC International ASA founded in 1981, with financial headquarters in Oslo, Norway and operational headquarters in Houston, Texas. The Company is led by CEO Kristian Johansen with nearly 500 employees around the globe with main offices located in Oslo, Houston, London, and Perth.
You can download theTGSlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: TGS
item.description: TGS-NOPEC Geophysical Company ASA, referred to as TGS and listed on the Oslo Stock Exchange, was founded by a 1998 merger of TGS, Calibre Geophysical Co. Inc, and NOPEC International ASA founded in 1981, with financial headquarters in Oslo, Norway and operational headquarters in Houston, Texas. The Company is led by CEO Kristian Johansen with nearly 500 employees around the globe with main offices located in Oslo, Houston, London, and Perth.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Widerøe Logo
Widerøes Flyveselskap AS, trading as Widerøe, is a Norwegian airline, and is the largest regional airline operating in the Nordic countries. The airline’s fleet of 40 Bombardier Dash 8 aircraft, and 3 Embraer E190-E2 aircraft, serves 41 domestic and 6 international destinations. Widerøe has a turnover of 4 billion kr; carries 2.86 million annual passengers; has 3,000 employees and performs 450 take-offs and landings each day. Public service obligation services to regional airports makeup slightly less than half of Widerøe’s operations.
You can download theWideroelogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Wideroe
item.description: Widerøes Flyveselskap AS, trading as Widerøe, is a Norwegian airline, and is the largest regional airline operating in the Nordic countries. The airline’s fleet of 40 Bombardier Dash 8 aircraft, and 3 Embraer E190-E2 aircraft, serves 41 domestic and 6 international destinations. Widerøe has a turnover of 4 billion kr; carries 2.86 million annual passengers; has 3,000 employees and performs 450 take-offs and landings each day. Public service obligation services to regional airports makeup slightly less than half of Widerøe’s operations.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Equinor Logo
Equinor ASA (OSE: EQNR, formerly Statoil and StatoilHydro) is a Norwegian multinational energy company headquartered in Stavanger, Norway. It is a petroleum and wind energy company with operations in thirty-six countries. By revenue, while under Statoil name, Equinor was ranked by Forbes Magazine (2013) as the world’s eleventh largest oil and gas company and the twenty-sixth largest company, regardless of industry, by profit in the world. The company has about 20,200 employees.
You can download theEquinorlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Equinor
item.description: Equinor ASA (OSE: EQNR, formerly Statoil and StatoilHydro) is a Norwegian multinational energy company headquartered in Stavanger, Norway. It is a petroleum and wind energy company with operations in thirty-six countries. By revenue, while under Statoil name, Equinor was ranked by Forbes Magazine (2013) as the world’s eleventh largest oil and gas company and the twenty-sixth largest company, regardless of industry, by profit in the world. The company has about 20,200 employees.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Olympics 1994 Lillehammer Logo The 1994 Winter Olympics (Norwegian: Olympiske vinterleker 1994), officially known as the XVII Olympic Winter Games, was a winter multi-sport event celebrated from 12 to 27 February 1994 in and around Lillehammer, Norway. Lillehammer failed to win the bid for the 1992 event, losing to Albertville. Lillehammer was awarded the 1994 Winter Olympics in 1988, after beating Anchorage, United States; Östersund, Sweden; and Sofia, Bulgaria. Lillehammer is the northernmost city to ever host the Winter Games and the Olympic Games overall.
You can download theOlympics 1994 Lillehammerlogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Olympics 1994 Lillehammer
item.description: The 1994 Winter Olympics (Norwegian: Olympiske vinterleker 1994), officially known as the XVII Olympic Winter Games, was a winter multi-sport event celebrated from 12 to 27 February 1994 in and around Lillehammer, Norway. Lillehammer failed to win the bid for the 1992 event, losing to Albertville. Lillehammer was awarded the 1994 Winter Olympics in 1988, after beating Anchorage, United States; Östersund, Sweden; and Sofia, Bulgaria. Lillehammer is the northernmost city to ever host the Winter Games and the Olympic Games overall.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Opera GX Gaming Browser Logo Opera GX is a gaming-oriented counterpart of Opera web browser for Microsoft Windows and macOS, developed by Opera Software AS. Opera GX was announced on June 11, 2019, the same day as the start of E3 2019. As of October 2020 it is in open Early Access. Source About Opera GX Browser Opera GX runs on both Windows 10 and macOS. Currently, there’s no mobile version, unlike with the normal Opera browser.
You can download theOpera GXlogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Opera GX
item.description: Opera GX is a gaming-oriented counterpart of Opera web browser for Microsoft Windows and macOS, developed by Opera Software AS. Opera GX was announced on June 11, 2019, the same day as the start of E3 2019. As of October 2020 it is in open Early Access. Source About Opera GX Browser Opera GX runs on both Windows 10 and macOS. Currently, there’s no mobile version, unlike with the normal Opera browser.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Opera Mini Logo Opera Mini is a mobile web browser developed by Opera Software AS. It was primarily designed for the Java ME platform, as a low-end sibling for Opera Mobile, but it is now developed exclusively for Android and iOS. It was previously developed for Windows 10 Mobile, Windows Phone 8.1, BlackBerry, Symbian, and Bada. Opera Mini Browser History On 16 August 2009, Opera Software released Opera Mini 5.
You can download theOpera Minilogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Opera Mini
item.description: Opera Mini is a mobile web browser developed by Opera Software AS. It was primarily designed for the Java ME platform, as a low-end sibling for Opera Mobile, but it is now developed exclusively for Android and iOS. It was previously developed for Windows 10 Mobile, Windows Phone 8.1, BlackBerry, Symbian, and Bada. Opera Mini Browser History On 16 August 2009, Opera Software released Opera Mini 5.

item.title: Opera News

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Opera Software Logo About Opera Software AG Opera Software AS is a Norwegian software company, primarily known for its desktop Opera web browser, and mobile web browser Opera Mini. It was demerged from its parent company Otello Corporation as part of the latter’s divestiture of its web browser business. Opera browsers have more than 350 million users worldwide across multiple platforms. Opera is also involved in promoting Web standards through participation in the W3C.
You can download theOpera Softwarelogo on full-version of the page. ]] >

item.description: About Opera Software AG Opera Software AS is a Norwegian software company, primarily known for its desktop Opera web browser, and mobile web browser Opera Mini. It was demerged from its parent company Otello Corporation as part of the latter’s divestiture of its web browser business. Opera browsers have more than 350 million users worldwide across multiple platforms. Opera is also involved in promoting Web standards through participation in the W3C.
